In addition to the direct deaths caused by opioids and other drugs occurring at unprecedented levels, the opioid epidemic has resulted in an increase in infections among PWUD, 10, 11, 12, 13, 14, 15 magnifying the morbidity and mortality associated with illicit opioid and other substance use. Such infections that are increasing related to illicit opioid and other drug use include HCV; hepatitis B virus; HIV; and invasive bacterial and fungal infections, including Staphylococcus aureus bacteremia, endocarditis, skin and soft tissue infections, and bone and joint infections.
